Title: Assistance to Ukraine
Questions: The EU should finance more weapons for Ukraine.
Reason: Providing Ukraine with more weapons is essential for its defense against ongoing aggression and maintaining its sovereignty.

Title: European Social Security Number
Questions: The EU should introduce a European social security number.
Reason: It could streamline cross-border benefits and simplify employment across EU member states.

Title: Stop subsidies for intensive livestock farming
Questions: Should the EU stop subsidizing intensive livestock farming?
Reason: Subsidies can incentivize practices with negative environmental and ethical impacts; their removal promotes sustainability.

Title: Third gender category in passports
Questions: The EU should recommend that member states add a third gender category to their passports.
Reason: Recognizing diverse gender identities in passports promotes inclusivity and acknowledges individual self-identification.

Title: Environmental impact labeling
Questions: All food products sold in the EU should have a label indicating their environmental impact.
Reason: Increased transparency would empower consumers to make more sustainable food choices and drive change.

Title: Higher CO2 taxes
Questions: Companies should pay more for their CO2 emissions.
Reason: It incentivizes emission reduction, fostering sustainable practices and mitigating climate change.

Title: Abolition of unanimity principle
Questions: The EU should abolish the principle of unanimity (give up the right of veto) in foreign, defense, and security policy.
Reason: Unanimity hinders swift action; qualified majority voting allows for more effective responses in crises.

Title: Fund for border defense
Questions: Should there be a special fund for building defensive fortifications on the EU’s external borders?
Reason: A dedicated fund would help manage and finance border security, improving control and safety.

Title: Development aid and immigration
Questions: The EU should limit development aid to countries that refuse to take back rejected asylum seekers.
Reason: Aid leverage can encourage cooperation on returns, addressing asylum system challenges and promoting fairness.

Title: Easier relocation for skilled workers
Questions: It should be easier for qualified workers to move to the European Union.
Reason: Facilitates economic growth, addresses labor shortages, and fosters cultural exchange within the EU.

Title: Ukraine’s EU membership
Questions: Ukraine should become a member of the European Union.
Reason: Ukraine's EU membership would strengthen Europe and support Ukraine's democratic aspirations and economic growth.

Title: Capping the Retirement Age
Questions: Should the EU cap the retirement age?
Reason: People's physical and mental capabilities differ; a fixed age limit is too restrictive and unfair.

Title: Support for kindergartens and childcare groups
Questions: Should the EU support the development of kindergartens and childcare groups?
Reason: Investing in early childhood education fosters societal equality and provides essential support for working families.

Title: Budget deficit
Questions: The EU should allow member states to have a higher budget deficit.
Reason: Flexibility during economic hardship is important for member states to stimulate growth and stability.

Title: Same-sex marriage ban
Questions: The ban on same-sex marriage should be abolished in all EU countries.
Reason: Marriage equality promotes human rights, providing equal opportunities and recognition for all loving couples.

Title: Financing the transition to renewable energy
Questions: Should the EU finance the transition of poorer households to renewable energy sources?
Reason: It promotes equity and ensures a just energy transition for vulnerable populations, reducing energy poverty.

Title: More funding for rural healthcare
Questions: The EU should provide more money for healthcare in rural areas.
Reason: Rural areas often face healthcare disparities; increased funding would improve access and outcomes.

Title: Investments in sustainable technologies
Questions: More public money should be provided for investments in sustainable technologies.
Reason: Public funding fosters innovation, accelerating the development and deployment of crucial sustainable solutions.

Title: Ban on glyphosate pesticides
Questions: Should the EU completely ban pesticides containing glyphosate?
Reason: A complete ban could harm agriculture. Alternative solutions should be considered, promoting sustainable farming.

Title: Public service media
Questions: The EU should continue to actively be interested in how public service media operate in member states.
Reason: It's crucial for upholding democratic values, media pluralism, and consistent broadcasting standards across the EU.

Title: Higher import duties on Chinese electric cars
Questions: Import duties on Chinese electric cars should be increased.
Reason: This protects domestic industries and encourages fair competition within the electric vehicle market.

Title: Election of the President of the Commission
Questions: The President of the European Commission should be directly elected by EU citizens.
Reason: Direct election would enhance democratic legitimacy and accountability to the EU citizenry.

Title: Restricted social assistance
Questions: Access to social assistance should be limited for citizens of other EU states living in a given country.
Reason: Free movement shouldn't automatically grant full welfare; residency duration/contribution should be a factor.

Title: Sanctions against Russia
Questions: The EU should maintain sanctions against Russia.
Reason: Continued sanctions pressure Russia to cease aggression and adhere to international law.

Title: Ban on Funding Coal-Fired Power Plants
Questions: Should the financing of coal-fired power plants from public funds be banned?
Reason: Public funds should prioritize cleaner energy sources, reducing emissions and promoting sustainability for the future.

Title: Adding EU-related topics to school curricula
Questions: Should school curricula be supplemented with topics related to the EU?
Reason: Understanding the EU is crucial for informed citizenship in the modern world; it promotes global awareness.

Title: Financing retraining programs
Questions: Should the EU finance programs for retraining workers?
Reason: Retraining supports workers' skills, boosts economic growth, and improves employment opportunities within the EU.

Title: Abolition of unpaid internships
Questions: The EU should abolish unpaid internships in vocational training.
Reason: Unpaid internships exploit workers, undermining fair labor practices and hindering equitable access to opportunities.

Title: Strengthening OLAF powers
Questions: The EU should strengthen the powers of the independent authority (OLAF) to fight fraud, corruption, and money laundering.
Reason: Stronger powers for OLAF would likely improve effectiveness in combating financial crimes within the EU.

Title: Ecological Farming Support
Questions: The EU should pay more money to farmers who use ecological practices.
Reason: It incentivizes sustainable agriculture, promoting biodiversity and environmentally friendly farming methods.

Title: Enforcement of EU laws and values
Questions: The EU should continue to stop funding member states that violate the rule of law.
Reason: Protecting the rule of law is paramount, and funding should be contingent on upholding those values.

Title: New European taxes
Questions: Do you support introducing new European taxes to finance the EU budget?
Reason: It could lead to a more stable and sustainable EU budget, fostering long-term planning and initiatives.

Title: Penalties for Unequal Pay
Questions: The EU should penalize companies for unequal pay between women and men.
Reason: Penalties incentivize fair practices, promoting gender equality and addressing systemic biases in compensation structures.

Title: Joint Military Procurement
Questions: EU member states should jointly purchase military equipment.
Reason: Joint procurement enhances efficiency, reduces costs, and fosters greater military interoperability within the EU.

Title: Fight against disinformation
Questions: Social networks should decide for themselves how to deal with disinformation spread on their platforms.
Reason: Unfettered control risks prioritizing profit over truth, potentially amplifying harmful content and misinformation.

Title: Ban on export of live farm animals
Questions: There should be a ban on exporting live farm animals outside the EU.
Reason: Animal welfare is paramount, and export conditions are often cruel and detrimental to their well-being.

Title: Erasmus+ scholarships
Questions: Students with fewer resources should be able to receive a higher Erasmus+ scholarship than students with more means.
Reason: Equity demands that those with greater financial need should receive more support for mobility.

Title: EU budget for weapons development
Questions: Should the development of weapons be financed from the EU budget?
Reason: The EU budget should prioritize peace-building and humanitarian aid, not the development of weapons.

Title: Rules for state aid to industry
Questions: Should the EU tighten rules for state aid to industry?
Reason: Tighter rules could foster fairer competition and prevent distortion of the single market.

Title: EU Common Army
Questions: The EU should have a common army.
Reason: A common army risks sovereignty; defense is best managed with national nuances and international cooperation.

Title: Facial Recognition Ban
Questions: Should the EU ban automatic facial recognition in public places?
Reason: It poses significant privacy risks and could lead to disproportionate surveillance without proper oversight.

Title: Public Access to Company Data
Questions: Should commercial data of companies in all EU countries be made available to the public?
Reason: Full public access may compromise sensitive business information and potentially harm competitiveness.
